153600.name: Braddock's Defeat: The Battle of Monongahela
153600.description:
Braddock’s Defeat is a low complexity conflict simulation of the French and Indian War battle that ended the British expedition to capture French Fort Duquesne. Not an ambush, as is popularly thought, the battle was actually a meeting engagement. The French in Fort Duquesne, told by scouts that a large British force with guns was approaching, sent elements of the Duquesne garrison on a preemptive strike. The French force met the British vanguard column before they could set up an ambush.

Braddock’s Defeat is a two player game with each player taking the side of either the French or the British. Both players have allies to control: the British side American colonial and Indian units, the French side Canadian militia and Indian units.

Braddock’s Defeat also is highly suitable for solitaire play.

This game was issued as a separate game as a gift to Gold donors for the 2014 Consimworld Donation Drive.

153601.description:
Spin the spinner and move up the path of the mystery mine. Along the way get clues about who is trying to keep you away. Eight exciting traps can get activated at any time, sending you flying back. The fall away bridge, the falling staircase, swinging gate, web flinger and more. Get to the top and reveal who the monster really is.

Players take on the role of one of their favorite Scooby characters. Players will solve the crime by collecting clues and using deduction. Players avoid traps like the Rube Goldberg style traps Freddie Jones employs during the show.
153601.name: Scooby-Doo Mystery Mine Board Game

153602.name: Irregular Magazine (Issue 8 - Spring 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Solid State War Dave Gaffham Models
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)
153602.description:
From editorial:

We’ve got another bumper issue, and this time the theme is Beasts.

153603.name: Skavenblight Gazette (Issue 13 - Dec 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Screaming Bell into Plague Claw Catapult
The True History of the Skaven
153603.description:
From publisher blurb:

Features:

Ask Seer Squeek
Interview: William King
Competition Winners: Show Your Inner Skaven
The True History of the Skaven
Feature Gallery: Children of the Horned Rat
Know Your Enemy
Contributer of Note: Craig Lee
Screaming Bell into Plague Claw Catapult

153604.name: Skavenblight Gazette (Issue 14 - May 2012)
153604.description:
From publisher blurb:

Features:

Ask Seer Squeek
Disease Transmission
Building An Army
Feature Gallery: Pestilent Blessing
Cooking with Pestilens
The Construction Workshop: Firing the Plagueclaw Catapult

153605.description:
The board depicts a circular spider web. Players move their five dice around the outer rim of the web, but have to cross it once in each of the four sectors. The players also control ten spider chips each with which they attempt to intercept the other player's dice and block the other player's spiders.

Game play is dice-driven: On a roll of a 6, a player enters the web and starts the journey with one die (subsequent sixes force him/her to add another die). After each move, a player places a new spider into the web (any position, but a different grid that has intersections with the one for the dice). Once all ten spiders have been placed, these can be after a die's movement. Spiders move any distance along the web, unless they are blocked by other spiders.

Every time a die crosses the web, it is turned up one number (starting with a one). If a die with a five on it reaches the starting position again, it is turned to a six and the owner wins the game.
153605.name: Das Spinnen Spiel

153606.name: The NOD Companion
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
153606.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement for the Blood & Treasure RPG collects in one place articles that players will find useful from NOD Magazine, including more than a dozen new character classes, new character races, new spells, new equipment and several optional rules to help customize your game experience. You’ll also learn the history of the NOD campaign setting and get a glimpse at just how large that setting is!

In more detail, the following is included in the game:

An overview of the NOD campaign setting
The History of NOD and its races
Racial Class Variants - Half-Orc Thug (Barbarian), Elven Gallant (Paladin), Dwarf Prospector (Thief), Gnome Prankster (Thief), Halfling Gypsy (Thief),
New Races - The Macabre, Notac-Ichat and Utu (the fellows on the cover)
New Classes - Anarchist, Beastmaster, Charlatan, Chevalier, Curmudgeon, Demoniac, Demonologist, Diablo, Elementalist, Gourmand, Jack-of-all-Trades, Leech, Psychic, Puritan, Scientist, Shadowdancer, She-Devil, Slave Girl, Soulknife, Tomb Raider, Valkyrie, Vampyre, Venturer, Vigilante, Wushen
New Weapons and Weapon Variations
New Armor
Partial Armor
Used Armor
New Henchmen and Hirelings
Clothes Make the Adventurer
New Spells - for the Charlatan and Elementalist, but most are available to other classes as well
Optional Rules
Proficiency System for Weapons, Tasks and Spells

Psionic Powers for All (including psychic duels)
New Heroic Tasks (Appraise Value, Attend Court, Communicate, Disguise, Drive Wagon, Gather Rumors, Identify Specimen, Note Unusual Stonework, Seafaring, Spelunking, Tumble)
Zero-Level Characters

153607.name: Trigger Happy
153607.description:
From publisher blurb:

Push The Envelope, Drop The Hammer and Take It To The Limit with Trigger Happy!

Trigger Happy takes place in a world turned up to eleven, where Protagonists live one trailer-worthy moment to the next. You’re a Protagonist; from rogue cop to war veteran to neighborhood kid done good enough, you find that the world tries to shove you around and you want to shove it right back!

The Trigger Happy roleplaying game encourages both action and story. From dynamic game mechanics which reward you for getting In and Out of trouble to a light but in-depth character creation system, Trigger Happy is the adrenaline-soaked thrill ride you have been waiting for!

Action.
Crime.
The World Hates You.
Hate It Right Back.

153608.name: Bangers
153608.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you can't Bang, you can't hang!

Superpowers are an urban problem, where kid and teen Bangers stake out turf and demand respect for their gangs with blasts of lightning and thrown cars. This exciting Add-On for the Trigger Happy RPG adds superpowers to the action, crime and grime, with gangers fighting the system and each other to make the best of their violent and complex lives.

The Bangers Add-On requires the Trigger Happy RPG to get full use, although much of the material is useful for other games.

153610.name: NOD (Issue 20 - Jul 2013)
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
153610.description:
From publisher blurb:

The twentieth issue of NOD finally arrives, detailing the fantasy colonial city of Dweomer Baye. This issue also includes the Vigilante class for Blood & Treasure, new aquatic monsters, cosmic hero Starman for Mystery Men!, an unholy relic, alien cocktails for Space Princess, random dungeon noises and the bogeyman!

153611.description: From the publisher: "Get ready to for high-flying fun with the Angry Birds UNO Card Game! It's the original UNO card game with colorful graphics and card illustrations from the popular app Angry Birds, plus a unique, special rule! Play the special King Pig card and choose a color. Each opponent then has to draw cards until they find a card that matches the selected color. It's fast fun for everyone, but especially Angry Birds fans."
153611.name: UNO: Angry Birds

153612.name: NOD (Issue 21 - Oct 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Getting There is Half the Annoyance
rpg: Blood & Treasure Fantasy Role Playing Game
153612.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOD 21 rolls into town just in time for Halloween with a dozen new spooky monsters, the Damnable Sea hex crawl, random party events, an easy system for randomized overland travel in games, a way to use combat to resolve non-combat tasks, a quartet of automaton races based on Greek myths, and a review of Jeffries' After London.

153614.name: January 2014: Alcohol
153614.description:
From Introduction:

Alcohol is one of man’s oldest technologies. Not simply an elixir to alleviate boredom, alcohol has multiple uses. Alcohol can be used as a fire starter, as a weapon in the form of molotov cocktails, as an antiseptic for wounds or to sterilize medical instruments. In certain cases it can be used as lamp fuel, stove fuel or even fuel in vehicles. Previous generations have used it to kill mold, remove stains, as a cough suppressant or even to quiet teething babies. Common alcohol does not always require large distilleries and heat sources to create. If time is not an issue, alcohol can ferment over the course of weeks and future supplies can be mixed and left alone until they are ready to consume. Below are two of the most common ways to craft alcohol.

153615.description: Players tour a map of Japan (or on the other side of the board, the world) as one of the characters from the Doraemon anime series, competing to see who can finish the course first.
153615.name: Dokodemo Doraemon Nihon Ryokou Game

153616.name: Expeditions: Conquistador
153616.description:
Expeditions: Conquistador is a tactical roleplaying game with a touch of strategic resource management and a pinch of choose-your-own-adventure. Conquistador is set in a rarely visited part of history which is rife with mystery, political intrigue, and good old-fashioned violence.

You will take on the role of a Spanish Conquistador in South America around 1520. Select the members of your expedition and explore campaign maps based on the actual topological maps of Hispaniola and Mexico. Through intricately branching dialogue, you will engage with the characters and situations that you encounter across these uncharted areas, and when it’s time to spill blood, a tactical combat system of great depth and brutality will let you control your individual troops in battle.

Combat is intimate and detailed, and failure has great consequences. Every expedition member has a face, a past, a set of personality traits, and of course a combat role – their morale will change depending on your decisions, they will chime in when you’re weighing your options, and if they fall in battle, their injuries will carry over to the world map, where they must be treated by your doctors until they’re back on their feet. Should you fail to treat your expedition members, they will die and be gone for good.

Choice and consequence is central to the play experience of Conquistador. As the leader of the expedition, you will face difficult decisions about the use of your troops and your resources, as well as how to engage with the factions of the savage New World. Will you defy history and be a diplomatic envoy of peace? Or will you be a ruthless conqueror determined to lay all of the Aztec Empire at your feet?

Source: The Game Website.

153617.name: Семейное древо
153617.description:
Семейное древо (Family Tree): the entertaining board genealogy.

Rightgames LLC and the “Mosaicum” project have released an educational board game, Family Tree. Players make up family trees during the game learning russian history and lifestyles of different generations. Family Tree inculcates interest to country’s past and own family history in a game form and develops improvisation and counting skills.

How much do we know about our ancestors? Where were they from? What job did they have and what were they fond of? How did they find their partners in life? We rarely think of it in our childhood but it’s getting harder to find the answers by each year passing by. That’s why it is so important to rouse up children’s interest in family history as early as possible. Understanding of generation continuity and forefathers’ connection with historical events is just necessary for the child to grow up as an all-sufficient and self-contained person.

Each player is telling a story of a common Russian family, constructing its genealogy table. The game is based on the character cards with people of different generations on them, born in pre-revolutionary times at the first half of the 20th century towards to people of nowadays. Each character has a name, a profession, a date of birth and a portrait designed in a family picture album style – all these traits combine into a whole appearance of a typical representative of his age and social group, like a soviet scientist or a present-day manager, for example.

Single characters don’t form a tree yet – they should be bound with family relationships. Married couples, children and parents need to be matched by age. It can be calculated in mind but birth dates are added to the cards for more convenience. After all, firstly, husbands and wives should meet each other: play a meeting card and tell a short acquaintance story. Also there are some event cards which can be played at the character, suitable by age – passing through the Great Patriotic war, attendance at Yuri Gagarin’s first space flight start, election to State Duma (Russian Lower chamber). In such a way a personal family history binds with the global history of the country.

There are two varieties of game rules: “The big family tree” and “Dynasties”. The first one better goes with big companies up to 10 players and is suitable for the first play. In this case players construct one big tree, and the one who will be the first in playing all cards from the hand wins the game.

“Dynasties” is a basic and mostly profound game mode comfortable up to 4 players. Each player makes up his own family tree or several at time which can be united during the game. Families of different players can become related with each other. Overall number of relatives, antiquity of the exact family name and participation in historical events influences the victory.

153618.name: Anduin (Issue 80 - Feb 2003)
153618.description:
This issue contains the third and last part of the DSA Schriftrollentrilogie adventures, as well as another DSA scenario - both with stats for 3rd and 4th edition alike. There's also a short Gemini adventure, and the obligatory NPC corner with three detailed NPCs/ monsters (without stats), this time for the cyberpunk genres.

Beyond that, articles about a DSA/ Halflife mod, the Nuremberg Spielwarenmesse, typical fantasy taverns, and realism/ logic at the gaming table plus reviews, fiction and comic

153619.name: Anduin (Issue 81 - Mar 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Conjunja: Eine Spielwelt jenseits der Rassenpiraterie
Die traurige Geschichte der Marie Claire
Grusel im Rollenspiel: Platzende Augen oder Gänsehaut?
Handouts im Fantasy-RPG: Dokumente künstlich altern lassen
Kämpfe in Cthulhu: Dunkle Junge von Shub-Niggurath vs. Cthulhu-Investigatoren
Vom Einstieg in Cthuloide Welten: Wie man ein Szenario für Cthulhu vorbereitet und leitet
[Lovarian Adventures] Kap. 3 Träume und Schatten, Teil 1
153619.description:
Due to the popularity of a former, Cthulhu-themed issue (#69), this issue returns to that focus. It includes scenarios (translated and new) and tips for GMs.

Also, there is an introduction to the world-building project Conjunja (which, unfortunately, never was completed).

153620.name: La Piel de Toro (revised)
153620.description:
CONTRAPORTADA

Hay quien dice que tiene forma de pentágono regular...
Otros prefieren ver en ella una Piel de Toro extendida...

España en los años veinte. Un país dónde jerarquías casi feudales se mezclan con los motores a explosión y los movimientos obreros.
Donde tradiciones milenarias se alternan con los bárbaros bailes modernos.
Donde las matronas enlutadas miran desconfiadamente a las jóvenes garçonettes modernas.
Un país con una monarquía, una dictadura y una guerra colonial.
Un rincón del mundo donde todo tiene cabida...
Hasta los terribles arcanos de los Mitos de Cthulhu...

Piel de Toro es un suplemento para el juego de rol "La Llamada de Cthulhu" que puede ser jugado tanto bajo la versión clásica (con sistema de porcentaje) como con la nueva versión en sistema D20.
En su interior el lector encontrará entre otras (muchas) cosas información precisa sobre la vida cotidiana en la España de Alfonso XIII, una descripción de las principales ciudades, un listado de ocupaciones para hacer Investigadores españoles, un capítulo completo sobre el sistema legal de la época y seis aventuras listas para jugar.

FROM THE BACK OF THE BOOK

Some say that regular pentagon shaped ...
Others prefer to see in it a widespread skin Toro ...

Spain in the twenties. A country where almost feudal hierarchies are mixed with combustion engines and labor movements .
Where alternate ancient traditions with modern dances barbarians .
Where the mourning matrons to look suspiciously modern young garçonettes .
A country with a monarchy , a dictatorship and a colonial war .
A corner of the world where everything has a place ...
Even the terrible secrets of the Cthulhu Mythos ...

Piel de Toro is a supplement to the role-playing game " Call of Cthulhu" which can be played both in the classic version (with percentage system ) and with the new version D20 system.
Inside the reader will find among others ( many ) things accurate everyday life in Spain of Alfonso XIII , a description of the major cities , list of occupations to Spanish researchers , an entire chapter on the legal system of information lists six time adventures to play.

153621.name: El Reino de la Sombra: Libro Básico
153621.description:
CONTRAPORTADA

Sé bienvenido, viajero, pues tus pasos te han llevado a Valsorth, tierra de maravilla y misterio, lugar donde la aventura aguarda detrás de cada colina de perfil amenazador, en lo profundo de un bosque tenebroso o en el interior de un templo erigido a un dios de nombre olvidado. Si eres valeroso, recompensas que jamás hubieses soñado serán tuyas, pero si tu coraje desfallece, tus huesos reposarán en una tumba sin nombre.

¡El fantástico mundo de los librojuegos de Leyenda Élfica cobra vida este juego de rol de fantasía! El esperado manual básico de El Reino de la Sombra trae todo el espíritu de la fantasía clásica y la nueva y mejorada versión del sistema NSd20. Un libro concebido como manual básico, pero con un completo escenario de campaña profusamente detallado y repleto de aventuras:

· Crea tu propio héroe en cinco minutos con las nuevas y mejoradas reglas de creación rápida del sistema NSd20... o saborea el proceso de creación detallada y decide cada pequeño aspecto del personaje: sin clases de personaje, sin niveles, ¡sin límites!

·Lucha como un caballero de la orden de Stumland, conviértete en uno de los escasos practicantes de las artes arcanas o suplica el favor de tus dioses en la batalla. ¡En este libro encontrarás reglas completas para el combate, la magia y los milagros!

·Visita el mundo de Valsorth y presencia en primera persona el resurgir del Reino de la Sombra. En cada lugar te esperan diversas aventuras listas para jugar y sugerentes ganchos para desarrollar tus propias historias.

·Vive la emocionante acción de las tres campañas prediseñadas que te permiten enlazar las distintas aventuras en una historia mayor de dimensiones épicas.

·Enfréntate a legiones de monstruos y conviértete en un nuevo héroe de Valsorth.


FROM THE BACK OF THE BOOK

Be welcome , traveler , for your steps you have taken to Valsorth land of wonder and mystery , a place where adventure awaits behind every hill menacing profile , deep in a dark forest or inside a temple to a god forgotten name . If you're brave , you would have never dreamed rewards will be yours , but if your courage falters , your bones will rest in an unmarked grave .

The fantastic world of gamebooks Elven Legend comes alive in this fantasy RPG ! The expected primer The Kingdom of Shadow brings the whole spirit of the classic fantasy and the new and improved version of NSd20 system. A book designed as a primer , but with a full campaign setting lavishly detailed and full of adventures :

· Create your own hero in five minutes with the new and improved rules NSd20 rapid creation of system ... or savor the process of creating detailed and decides every little aspect of the character : Character classless , smoothly ,without limits!

· Fight Like A Knight of the Order of Stumland , become one of the few practitioners of the arcane arts and begs the favor of your gods in battle. This book contains complete rules for combat , magic and miracles !

· Visit the world of Valsorth and presence firsthand the resurgence of the Shadow Realm . In each place different adventures await you ready to play and enticing hooks to develop your own stories.

· Experience the thrilling action of the three campaigns that allow you to link art the various adventures in a larger story of epic proportions .

· Take on legions of monsters and become a hero again Valsorth

boardgamehonor: 2014 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Nominee
2014 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Two-players Winner
153623.description:
Two thousand years ago on the borders of the Roman Empire, life goes on as might be expected — but barbarians lurk across the border, so not only must the players grow grain in the fields, catch fish, and chop wood, but they must also maintain watchmen in a clever network of watchtowers to keep a lookout for fires and barbarian attacks.

Limes is based on the designer's board game Cities, and while the game system is roughly the same, the scoring is completely different. In addition, the tiles in Limes have a different layout from those in Cities. Together, these changes ensure that Limes has become an entirely new game. (Limes includes two sets of cards, one for each player, but if you combine copies of the game, any number of people can play at the same time.)

Each player has his own deck of cards. One player shuffles his deck, then places a card at random on the table; each other player takes this same card and places it on the table in his own area. Each player can optionally place one of his figures on this card; once a figure is placed on a card, it cannot be returned to the supply. The second card played (and all subsequent cards) much be placed adjacent to or touching the corner of an already-played card. After each card placement, a player can either place a new figure on this card or move an already-placed figure; a figure can move from one territory to an adjacent territory, e.g., from woods to lake or from grain fields to woods.

The game ends as soon as any player has placed 16 cards in a square (4x4 grid). Each player then receives points as follows:


Farmers receive one point for each connected grain field.
Fishermen receive one point for every house situated directly adjacent to their lake.
Watchmen receive one point for every patch of woods they can see in a straight line (north, east, south, west) from their tower; other watchtowers block their view, so they can't see woods behind those towers.
Woodcutters receive one point for every territory to which they can deliver wood, e.g., every different adjacent territory.


The player with the most points wins, with ties being broken in favor of the player who has the highest score with a single figure.
153623.name: Limes
boardgamepodcastepisode: nba005 – Grenzerfahrungen

153624.description:
Oink! challenges players to make lightning-fast strikes when two similar animals appear on the table — but in addition to striking the table, they need to make the proper animal noise faster than anyone else, and whoever does so claims all of the available cards. Watch out, though, as the naughty pig intrudes again and again between other animals with a loud "Oink!"

In more detail, shuffle the ninety cards and deal them equally face-down to all players, who then takes turns drawing one card and playing it on top of a central pot. Should an animal be added to the pile while it's already the top card, players race to strike the table while woofing, baaing or otherwise making the sound of the animal depicted. Should the top two cards sum to 7, however, players must strike the table and "Oink!" at the same time. While the numbers on most animals range from 0-6, the pig has special rules, with a 7 on each card; thus, whenever a pig is placed on the pile, everyone must race to slap and oink as quickly as possible! Whenever a player correctly slaps the pile, she places the cards aside in a score pile; if incorrect, she must add a card from her deck to the discard pile (or scratch her head while making monkey noises, as the players prefer).

When all players run out of cards — or when at least one player is out and someone has claimed the pile — the game ends. Players then compare the height of their score piles to see who's claimed the most cards and won.
153624.name: Oink!

153625.description:
For the most part, Han uses the same gameplay as China, also from designer Michael Schacht, but the maps on the double-sided game board introduce new rules and variants.

In general, players use cards to place pieces (houses or emissaries) into the nine regions on the board. To place in a region, a player must play a card of that region's color or two cards of the same color as a joker; a player can place at most two pieces in a region on a turn, but only one piece if the region was unoccupied at the start of the turn. One side of the game board — titled "Grenzstreitigkeiten", or "Border Disputes", and made for 3-5 players — includes house sites that straddle two regions; to claim one of these locations, a player must discard two appropriately-colored cards. The number of emissaries in a region is limited to the number of houses of the same color in that same region.

When all house spaces in a region are filled (or at the end of the game), players score for that region. Whoever has the most houses in that region scores one point for each house in the region, whoever has the secondmost houses scores one point for each house of the player who has the most, and so on.

At game end, players also score for having majorities of emissaries in two adjacent regions, scoring as many points as the number of emissaries in both regions. Players also score for having four or more houses in an uninterrupted sequence along one of the roads on the board. On the "Grenzstreitigkeiten" game board, players also score majority points for the houses in the port cities located in multiple regions, these port cities effectively forming their own region. Whoever scores the most points wins.

"Grenzstreitigkeiten" has one variant. Each player starts with one fortification in addition to his other pieces. Once per game, a player can play two matching cards, then place his fortification on a house site, then top it with a house. Whenever this house scores — whether for the region majority, for being a port city, or for being part of a sequence — the house's owner scores double the points he normally would.

The other side of the game board — "Wege der Diplomatie", or "Ways of Diplomacy", which is made for 2-4 players — also has a variant, with each player receiving a marketplace. Once per game, a player can play two matching cards, then place the marketplace on a house site, then top it with an emissary (not a house). This allows a player to compete for emissary points in a region that is otherwise full.
153625.name: Han

153626.name: Cabela's African Adventures
153626.description:
User Summary

Cabela's African Adventures is a hunting sim.

boardgameimplementation: WWF World Wrestling Federation Wrestling Trivia Game
153627.description:
WWE Trivia Mania is a roll and move professional wrestling trivia game for 2 to 4 players. In Trivia Mania, players vie to win 4 different Championship Rings at WrestleMania by answering trivia questions about the wrestlers, events, and history of World Wrestling Entertainment.

On your turn, roll the die, move that many spaces, and answer a question. Certain spaces allow you to win Championship Rings, either from the supply or from other players. First player to win their fourth and final Championship Ring on the WrestleMania space is the winner.
153627.name: WWE Trivia Mania

153629.name: Irregular Magazine (Issue 9 - Summer 2011)
rpgissuearticle: On a Wing and a Prayer
Tablets in Wargaming a device for the future
The Campaign for Redruth & Camborne A Very British Civil War
The Empty Mirror: A Macabre Tale of Murder and Supernatural Mystery
153629.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This issue our theme is Pulp. Cover artist David North has created a superb cover which includes many of our favourite Pulp themes.As usual we have reviews, tutorials, articles and a two short stories plus another episode of our comic Tuk Tuk.

153631.name: Gates & Portals
153631.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the gates and portals in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Gates & Portals is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Gates & Portals presents:


One table (100 entries) providing detailed descriptions of a gate or portal’s characteristics.
One table (100 entries) presenting additional features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
One table (100 entries) presenting the locations to which a gate or portal leads.

153632.name: The Maelstrom Incarnate
153632.description:
A universal supplement for Apocalypse World Character Playbooks.

From introduction:

Some people open their brains to the Maelstrom. That wasn't enough for you. Nothing short of your soul would do. Only one problem, it's kinda stuck now. Your body lies in ruins, an empty husk now. It's not going to do you much good. All that's left is to move on to bigger, better things.

153633.name: Windgeflüster (Issue 57 - Winter 2007/2008)
rpg: It Came from the Late, Late, Late Show (1st, 2nd & 3rd edition)
153633.description:
User summary

This is the first Windgeflüster issue in full colour. It contains GFR news, information on conventions, articles, reviews and an interview that also adress other media (literature, movies, board games), introductions to two RPGs (Funky Colts and It came from the late, late show = Monster aus der Spätvorstellung). There is also an adventure for the latter: Grand Prix des Grauens.

153634.name: Irregular Magazine (Issue 10 - Autumn 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Blast From the Past Fighting Fantasy Books
The First Day of the Last Day of the First Day
153634.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This issue the theme is Apocalypse. In our tutorial section we have a guide to painting a Firestorm Armada space ship. In RPG we take a look at possible apocalyptic scenarios. The community section has a showcase with David North, cover artist of issue 9, and a report on IMP 2011 show. Nick Johnson builds a theme deck for the Legend of the Five Rings CCG and Dave Barker looks back at the Fighting Fantasy books. We have a short story from Taylor Holloway, plus plenty of great reviews, Tuk Tuk from Will Kirkby, news and much, much more.

153635.name: Politics
153635.description:
Politics is played on a board (referred to as the political field) consisting of an outer square, and a series of inner squares of various sizes arranged within the outer square, each of them rotated 45 degrees from each other so that their corners bisect the other squares' sides. These points (24 of them) are referred to as stations. The two players have different colored pieces. There are three sizes of game piece; each player has two statesmen (large,) four politicians (medium,) and six voters (small,) for a total of twelve, referred to as that player's phalanx.

The game begins with players taking turns placing any one of their pieces on any one station. Like Mill, when a player is able to line up three of his pieces in a row, he is then entitled to remove one of his opponent's pieces, but in the case of this game, only voters may be removed in this fashion. Unlike Mill, pieces in Politics may jump and capture each other as in Checkers, in any direction, once the initial placement phase is concluded. A piece may only jump a like-sized or smaller piece. To win, one must reduce the opponent to only two pieces, or to immobilize his remaining pieces.

153636.name: Wie Du mir: raus mit Dir!
153636.description:
Objective:
Be the first entering target spaces with all of your tokens.

2 or 4 players; moving by turns.

Place all of your tokens (6 or 12/starting positions), roll the die and move forward with one of them according to the result. Ending on an occupied space opposing token is hit & must start again. Ending on a red space you must start again. Reaching target (opposite ground) token is safe.

Likely published during 1920/30s.

153638.name: Cube World
153638.description:
User Summary

Cube World is a voxel-based, procedural game focused on exploration and action-adventure elements. Choosing from 4 character classes, players are tasked with exploring an effectively infinite world populated with cities, dungeons, monsters, animals and quests.

Beyond dungeoneering, exploration and questing, Cube World also features resource collection, a crafting system, as well as animal and monster taming.

boardgamepublisher: Shanghai Creative Tree Cultural Spreading Co. LTD.
153639.description: Take over the world in Zeppelin Attack, a deck building game set in the world of Evil Hat Productions' Spirit of the Century. You play villainous masterminds bent on world domination. To win, you must build a powerful deck of Zeppelin cards, weapons, defenses and operatives, and then use these to fight your opponent’s Zeppelins. The player who gets the most points from winning battles and acquiring valuable cards will win the game. There’s only room for one ultimate criminal overlord: you. Bring your zeppelins.
153639.name: Zeppelin Attack!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dice Tower News 222 - February 21, 2014

153641.name: Laundromat
153641.description: Laundromat is a card game about picking up "chicks" at laundromats. The object is to date enough women to obtain “12 women points” before the other players do. Each card has a value from 1-5 depicting a woman doing laundry. On their turn, players will either date the unattractive (low value cards) gals outright, or roll dice for chances at the "hotter babes" (higher value cards).

153642.name: Numenera Creature Deck
rpghonor: 2014 Ennie for Best Aid/Accessory - Gold Winner
153642.description:
'user summary

This deck contains 100 of the most commonly encountered creatures in the Ninth World, drawn from both the Numenera corebook and The Ninth World Bestiary. When you need to build an encounter (either when prepping your game or at the gaming table), simply draw a card from this deck. You’ve got basic stats (with a reference to the corebook, for full stats and info) on one side, and an image to share with your players on the reverse.

153643.name: Tintin on the Moon
153643.description:
Tintin on the Moon is a video game loosely based on Explorers on the Moon from the series The Adventures of Tintin, the comics series by Belgian cartoonist Hergé. It is a first person shoot 'em up/side scroller and one of the first Tintin video games. This video game was originally made by Infogrames for various home platforms in 1987 and was converted to MS-DOS by Probe Entertainment in 1989. The game's storyline is based loosely on the plot of the "Explorers on the Moon" comic book from the series. The object of the game is to land on the moon, while avoiding asteroids and thwarting enemies within the rocket.
Tintin on the Moon was the first PC game to feature the character Tintin.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tintin on the Moon," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

153644.name: Ars Malefica
153644.description:
publisher blurb

Ars Maleficent is the new supplement Coven play medieval demonic role. This is a comprehensive volume that delves into paganism, witchcraft and its manifestation in medieval Spain. In its nearly 200 pages you will find:

A wealth of information about the pagan faiths, peoples that practiced, their gods and customs.
A complete list of pagan spells, whose powers rival those of Hell.
A bestiary with gods, geniuses and mythical animals of pagan tradition.
Complete information about the allies of evil, from the Witches to the conjurers.
New spells and rituals to fight evil or serving
Ten new professions to travel the paths of paganism and witchcraft, new pride and shame, event tables, family rules and more.
A complete adventure ready to play, where the characters discover the secret that lies behind a mysterious plague of wolves.

In spanish:

Amo y señor Lucifer: Os reconozco mi dios y príncipe y prometo serviros y obedeceros mientras viva. Renuncio a otro Dios, como Jesucristo, a los santos y santas y a la Iglesia Apostólica y Romana, a sus Sacramentos y a todas las oraciones y preces que los fieles puedan impetrar por mí. Prometo hacer todo el mal que pueda y que los demás hagan. Renuncio al crisma, al bautismo, a todos los méritos de Jesucristo y de sus santos; y si dejo de serviros, adorados, y no me postro ante vos una vez al día, os doy mi vida como vuestro bien.

Ars Malefica es el nuevo suplemento para Aquelarre el juego de rol demoníaco medieval. Se trata de un completo volumen que profundiza en el paganismo, la brujería y su manifestación en la España medieval. En sus casi 200 páginas encontrarás:

Abundante información sobre los credos paganos, los pueblos que los practicaban, sus dioses y costumbres.
Una completa lista de conjuros paganos, cuyos poderes rivalizan con los del Infierno.
Un bestiario con dioses, genios y animales míticos de la tradición pagana.
Información completa sobre los aliados del maligno, desde las brujas hasta los conjuradores.
Nuevos conjuros y rituales para combatir al maligno o servirlo.
Diez nuevas profesiones para recorrer los senderos del paganismo y la brujería, nuevos orgullos y vergüenzas, tablas de eventos, reglas de familiares y mucho más.
Una completa aventura lista para jugar, donde los personajes descubrirán el secreto que se oculta tras una misteriosa plaga de lobos.

153645.name: Buttons and Scissors
153645.description:
Cut off the sewing buttons in the logic game Buttons and Scissors! To cut off the buttons, select two or more buttons of the same color. You can select buttons only on the same horizontal, vertical or diagonal line. Cut off all the buttons from the scrap of denim to complete the level. Try to complete each level in the shortest time possible to get a better score.
You cannot cut off a single button, so plan your strategy in advance! Buttons and Scissors is a fun way to improve your logical thinking and train your brain.

Source: The Developer Website.

153646.description:
A card game of witches and potions! You are a witch of the classic green skinned, pointy hatted variety, in competition with your weird sisters for that iconic status symbol: loads of warts!

Each card is an ingredient, and the cards interact based on their colors. As you add them to your cauldron, they have various effects, and when you have all four colors present, your potion goes POOF! If you had the right stuff in there, when the fumes clear out you'll be wartier than ever. All your sisters will be jealous.

But that's not all. In the heap of entrails and goop lie some of those most dreaded ingredients: healthy vegetables! Toss them into your opponents' cauldrons to spoil what would otherwise have been an absolutely disgusting brew, or, if you've got just the right color balance, you can use them to set your potion off with only minimal side effects!

Gameplay is three rounds. Each player gets 1 poof per round and may play 1 card per turn unless a card allows otherwise. When a player has poofed, their cauldron is reheating and is closed until the next round, so they may only play cards into other players' cauldrons until then. Cards may add or remove cards from cauldrons, cause players to draw or discard cards, give or take away warts, and plenty more specific gameplay-manipulating effects.

Number of players for one deck can be 2-6, although larger numbers of players can be supported by simply mixing in an additional deck.
153646.name: BrewHaha

153647.name: Word Science
153647.description:
User Summary

Word Science is an game of quick spelling from streams of letters appearing on the screen.

There are a few boosts and help keys you can use to buy time or get the letters you need.

153648.description:
Fief: France 1429 is a game of dynastic ambition, where players assume the roles of nobles in the 15th century Kingdom of France.

Teutonic Knights is an expansion of the game Fief: France 1429 that includes new cards and counters so the players will be able to build a secret network of influence and movement. The Teutonic Knight elected "Grand Master" will gain 1 victory point.
153648.name: Fief: France 1429 – Teutonic Knights Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Board Game Interview Room with Uwe Eickert

153649.name: What's Cookin'
153649.description: What's Cookin' is a family game from the heyday of Scratch 'n' Sniff. Players roll a die with the Chef dice tower and move around the board, visiting as many as five different restaurants over the course of the game. Upon arriving at a restaurant, the player selects a card, scratches, sniffs, and announces to the table what he suspects the food to be. The player then opens the card, revealing it only to himself. If correct, he keeps it and earns a point toward winning the game. If incorrect, he closes his eyes and the player to his left swaps it with a card from another restaurant. Play rotates and continues until all of the cards have been correctly identified. Whoever has identified the most foods wins!

153651.name: NHL Challenge
153651.description:
Here is your chance to play for the most coveted trophy in team sports: The Stanley Cup®. This quick, simple, exciting game pits you and a fellow coach head-to-head in a best of seven series. Or, you and your friends can play an entire National Hockey League playoff, starting with up to sixteen teams until it's down to the final two. Pick your starting line-up, skillfully play your Stanley Cup® cards and then roll the dice. The winner can proudly display Lord Stanley's symbol of hockey supremacy. That is, until the time you face the NHL® Stanley Cup® Challenge!

This is also an expansion pack for the award-winning NHL® Big League Manager board game.

153652.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 270 - Feb 1998)
153652.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #270
February 1998

Cover art by Quentin Westcott.

153653.description:
Ph. D. The Game is a card game that places players directly in the middle of a graduate school scientific research lab. Players are required to draw, play, and discard cards, competing with each other to be the first member of their lab to graduate.

Getting publications accepted is never easy but Lab Member Cards and other graduate school themed Action Cards such as "Committee Meeting" and "Your PI Lost Funding" will either help you or hurt your other labmates. When you obtain enough Figure Cards, you can submit your publication for review (which will not always get accepted of course!).

Get enough accepted publications and you will become the first member of your lab to graduate with your Ph.D.!

This game truly embodies both the stress and accomplishment of going to graduate school.

"Much more fun than grad school."
153653.name: Ph. D. The Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game of Crowd Funding Dan Letzring Interview 02-18-2015

153654.description:
"The colorful family game of rolling, sliding and stacking...."

Players roll a large color-dot die, and then must try to remove a corresponding colored block from the tower and place it on top of the tower. The last player to make a successful play before the tower falls wins the game.

This game is similar to some Jenga versions that have colored planks, but has more colors.

Similar to Tumblin Dice Timberrr but this game has more planks (54 vs 48), it has more colors (6 vs 5), and there are some differences in the rules, perhaps the main one being that there is no option to "Pass" on the die, so that players are on the hot seat every turn and don't get any turns during which they are not at risk.
153654.name: Rainbow Timber

153655.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The set comes with 2 types of dice: Blue and Red. Red is used for attacking and blue is used for ammo checks. The red die has a Z in place of 6 bullet hole pips, to denote a possible zombie bite, while the blue die has a 'click' symbol in place of the one's spot to denote your weapon is out of ammo. Very useful for 4-person games, or for your own custom homebrew games.
153655.name: Zpocalypse: Deluxe Dice Pack

153656.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Finding yourself facing endless numbers of zombies but not enough miniatures? This box incudes 20 Zpocalypse miniatures to bring a whole new meaning to Horde! Requires the main Zpocalypse game to play.
153656.name: Zpocalypse: Horde-in-a-Box

153657.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Psst. Hey. Yeah, you. What are you doing hiding here in the dark? Are you hoping that the zombies will pass you by and leave you to fight another day? How about playing with our glow-in-the-dark dice while you wait? These dice have the same style as our Zpocalypse game dice. What you do with them in pitch-black game situations is up to you. Each set comes with 8 glow in the dark special Z Dice.
153657.name: Zpocalypse: Glow Dice

153658.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Zpocalypse Zmergency Hospital Horde: enhances Zpocalypse with new hospital-themed zombie miniatures! Includes 8 new zombie types including, zombie nurses, doctor, straight jacket, bio suit and even zombie children! A total of 24 miniatures are included in this set. Requires the main Zpocalypse game to play.
153658.name: Zpocalypse: Zmergency – Hospital Horde

153659.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This adapter set includes 8 specially cut tiles which allow you to combine front and back sides of existing Zpocalypse tiles in the same game. In addition there are 8 flat sided adapters, which allow you to use Zpocalypse tiles with non Greenbrier games tiles for your own custom zombie/wasteland themed games. The 8 doubled sided Zpocalypse tiles feature a Road on one side and Toxic River on the other.
153659.name: Zpocalypse: Adapter Set 2.0

153660.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fortification Pack includes 41 post-apocalyptic fortifications. Designed to enhance the parent game, Zpocalypse, the 3D fortification miniatures replace their cardboard counter parts. However, there is nothing stopping you from using them for your own mischievous ends in any other tabletop games. Each miniature comes fully assembled and unpainted.
153660.name: Zpocalypse: Aftermath – Fortification Pack

153661.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Z-Team Beta is a collection of miniature Survivors specifically designed to work with the board game Zpocalypse, as well as games using 25-28mm scale miniatures. New characters, scenarios and weapons cards bring a whole new set of challenges and adventures to the world of Zpocalypse. How would you like to bring Squad members back from the dead? Or use a sniper rifle that has unlimited range and can shoot through walls? That is just a taste of the exciting new content! Each miniature comes fully assembled and unpainted. Requires the main Zpocalypse game to play.
153661.name: Zpocalypse: Aftermath – Z-Team Beta Pack

153662.name: Intrigue at the Court of Chaos
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
153662.description:
Publisher Blurb:

At the mercy of Chaos! Abducted by the Court of Chaos, the adventurers face hard choices if they want to return home. The Host of Chaos desires a legendary artifact held by the Scions of Law and need patsies to retrieve it. Faced with an eternity of servitude, the party must sneak into the Plane of Law and steal the Yokeless Egg from under its guardians' watch. But not all is what it appears when the Court of Chaos is concerned and serving the Host may destroy the party from within. Can they survive the Intrigue At the Court of Chaos?

153663.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Warmachine dice set for Mercenaries faction, produced together with Privateer Press. The only one original! Show your fraction pride with the official dice of WARMACHINE! This set of six premium six-side dice, designed by Privateer Press, includes five dice featuring the colors and iconography of the faction and one WARMACHINE die perfect for AOE deviation and damage location rolls.
153663.name: Warmachine: Mercenaries Faction Dice

153664.name: Mass Effect 3: Omega
153664.description:
Omega has been seized by one of Cerberus' most accomplished and brilliant agents, General Oleg Petrovsky…and Aria T'Loak is plotting her revenge. To reclaim her domain, she must team up with Commander Shepard.

Join Omega’s infamous leader in her fight to retake the notorious black market station. Navigate Omega’s seedy underbelly as Aria joins your squad and you witness her legendary biotic powers and unrelenting ruthlessness first-hand. Help Nyreen Kandros, the valiant turian leader of the Talon mercenary group, as she fights to free the enslaved people of Omega. Face down fearsome new enemies, including the Cerberus-manipulated Reaper, the Adjutant.

Shape Omega’s future through four death-defying missions, and strike a devastating blow to the Illusive Man's plans.

The war for Omega has begun—How far will you go to end it?

Source: The Developer Website.

153665.name: Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2013
153665.description:
User Summary

Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2013 is a hunting sim. It features a light-gun called the Fearmaster, which comes equipped with both a heart monitor and motion sensor.

153666.name: Cabela's Survival: Shadows of Katmai
153666.description:
User Summary

As pilot James Logan you must survive the frigid Alaskan wilderness by any means necessary.

153669.name: Keyword
153669.description: Make the longest word and collect letters. The first player to create the keyword using the letters he has collected, cracks the code and wins the game. If nobody cracks the code before either one deck runs out of cards, the player who created the most words will win the game.

153670.description:
Children's game that appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1995.

It is a game for two people. One is Postman Pat and the other is Peter Fogg. There are two tracks that lead to Ingledale (space 18). It is a simple roll and move game. Each player moves on their track and must obey instructions when they land on certain spaces. First to the end of their track, wins.
153670.name: A Trip to Ingledale

153671.name: Legends II
153671.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents 50 more great legends to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Legends II is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Legends II presents:


Lost Treasures: Ten legends about treasures lost in the dungeon.
Famed Adventurers: Ten legends about adventurers connected to the dungeon.
Dungeon Features: Ten legends about the dungeon’s notable features.
Dungeon Inhabitants: Ten legends about the dungeon’s inhabitants.
Events & Deeds: Ten legends about the events and deeds associated with the dungeon.

153672.name: Mundane Chest Contents
153672.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane contents to add to the chests in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Mundane Chest Contents presents:


One table (100 entries) listing clothes and vestments found in chests.
One table (50 entries) presenting lists of nonmagical things a wizard may store in a chest.
One table (50 entries) presenting lists of things a priest would store in his chest.
One table (50 entries) presenting lists of food and drink stored in chests.
One table (50 entries) presenting lists of odds and sundries stored in chests.

153673.name: Simple Magic Traps
153673.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great simple magic traps to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Simple Magic Traps is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

153674.name: Tapestries
153674.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the tapestries in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Tapestries is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Tapestries presents:


A table presenting descriptions of 50 tapestries.
A table presenting 100 pieces of tapestry dressing to breathe life into your creation.
Four clever, challenging tapestry-based traps (CRs 3-9).

153675.name: Wells
153675.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic?

Then Dungeon Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and cool noteworthy features.

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the wells in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Wells is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Dungeon Dressing: Wells presents:


One table (100 entries) providing detailed descriptions of a well’s characteristics.
One table (100 entries) presenting additional features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
Three clever well-based traps.

153677.name: Irregular Magazine (Issue 11 - Winter 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Airship Pirates Behind the scenes of an RPG
Blast from the Past Mordheim: City of the Damned
A Call to Arms: Star Fleet
Making planets, celestial bodies and space stations
Raid 25: Ride Around Missouri – Shelby’s Great Raid 1863
Raid: The Revenge of the 47 Ronin - Edo, 1703
153677.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Our Winter’s Eve themed issue of the magazine is once more jam-packed with some excellent articles and tutorials. We look at the D8 RPG Sins, and the Abney Park’s Airship Pirates RPG, and focus on the artwork for Airship Pirates with an interview of some of the artists involved. There are two tutorials; a seasonal guide to snow basing and the first of a series of articles focusing on terrain for spaceship wargaming looking at making planets. There are also plenty of reviews and yet another great instalment of Tuk Tuk and much more!

153678.name: Irregular Magazine (Issue 12 - Spring 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Making planets, celestial bodies and space stations - part 2
Notables of Flathead’s Romance: Heroes and Villains for Traveller RPG
153678.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Another great issue packed with excellent articles and tutorials. We have a great retrospective looking at a Empire, a computer game from the 70s that is still being played today on the internet. We also have another peek into our developing world for the Traveller RPG, this time some NPCs for players to encounter, there is a review of Leeds Armouries and a look at how the Goths played a part in the downfall of Rome.

There are three tutorials this month; two great guides from Lyn Sthal – a guide to basing and a tutorial on painting faces. We also have the second of a series of articles by Alex Garbett focusing on terrain for spaceship wargaming. This article looks at making stars. There is also our usual review section and a new instalment of Tuk Tuk, by the talented Will Kirby in yet another packed edition of the magazine.

153679.name: Urknall: Supernova
153679.description:
Translated from the German text on the publisher's website:

The expansion contains a rulebook and a single game piece.

The Supernova adds extra uncertainty to the game. If a star becomes a supernova the possession ratios are lost and it is played again.

Counting the supernova: at end of the game every possession marker gets you as many points as elements of the same color are present. It is not about possession ratio. Every possession marker counts.

153680.name: Android Assault: The Revenge of Bari-Arm
153680.description:
From the back of the box:

Launched by the Alien Planet Zias, an Armada of androids has crushed the Earth's conventional space fleet. Desperate and defeated, The United Nations of Earth has no choice but to counter-attack with its own living, fighting machine, Bari-Arm.

Upgrade weapons to get the awesome firepower of the Thundercracker, Burning Wave & Chase Cannon. Explosions are made even more real with arcade style graphics and CD quality sound! Check-out weird, futuristic moonscapes with huge, butt-kickinmg bosses at every level.

153681.name: Sciences Forensiques & Psychologies Criminelles
153681.description:
QUATRIÈME PAGE

Depuis l’origine des sciences criminelles du XIXe siècle jusqu’à la pointe des technologies biologiques actuelles, les techniques d’investigation n’ont cessé de progresser. Mises au service de la vérité, elles s’appuient sur les savoirs faires et les méthodes éprouvées par des générations de professionnels. Leur haut niveau d’expertise permet de confondre les criminels et de percer à jour les personnalités les plus complexes.

Avec Sciences Forensiques & Psychologies Criminelles, découvrez les authentiques techniques d’investigations mises au point par les enquêteurs au fil des époques : récolte et analyse des preuves matérielles d’une scène de crime, gestion et contrôle des situations de crise, conduite d’un interrogatoire, déroulé d’une autopsie et conclusions d’experts. Pour L’Appel de Cthulhu, cet ouvrage permet l’interprétation d’enquêteurs modernes et étend les champs de recherches aux périodes contemporaines. Avec ces nouvelles connaissances, il propose de plonger dans les méandres de la psyché perverse des tueurs en série. Pour les autres jeux de rôles d’enquêtes, cet ouvrage de vulgarisation permet une meilleure connaissance des techniques d’investigation.

Edité une première fois sous le titre de « Forensic, Profiling & Serial Killer », et rapidement épuisé, l’ouvrage bénéfice d’ajouts qui l’ont fait doubler de volume. Les Sciences Forensiques sont complétées de l’examen d’une scène de crime. Le volet Profiling est mis à jour et complété de l’histoire de la psychiatrie. Les portraits de tueurs célèbres de 1920 à 1950 s’ajoutent à la galerie du chapitre Serial Killer. Un nouveau chapitre a été intégré sur le métier d’enquêteur : comment incarner un policier, l’historique des polices et du FBI, le crime organisé aux USA et des « cas bizarres ». Les amateurs de surnaturels apprécieront le chapitre relatif aux divers cultes et en particulier aux preuves forensiques du passage des créatures du Mythe !
Enfin, l’ouvrage inclus trois scénarios originaux dédiés à l’investigation se déroulant aux Etats Unis ou en France, dans les années 20 ou de nos jours.

Sciences Forensiques & Psychologies Criminelles est l’outil indispensable à l’écriture de véritables scénarios d’investigations. Les nombreuses anecdotes et études de cas sont autant de sources d’inspirations.


FROM THE BACK OF THE BOOK

Since the beginning of the nineteenth century forensics to the forefront of current biological technologies, investigation techniques have increased steadily. Placed at the service of truth, they are based on knowledge and proven methods faires by generations of professionals. Their high level of expertise can convict criminals and to see through the most complex personalities.

With Forensic Science & Criminal Psychologies , discover authentic technical investigations developed by the investigators through the ages : collecting and analyzing physical evidence from a crime scene management and control of crisis situations, driving a examination, conducted an autopsy and conclusions of experts. For Call of Cthulhu , this book allows the interpretation of modern investigators and extends the field of research to contemporary periods. With this new knowledge , it offers diving into the intricacies of perverse psyche of serial killers. For other games of roles surveys, this popular book provides a better understanding of investigative techniques.

Published for the first time under the title of " Forensic , Profiling & Serial Killer ", and quickly sold out , the book profit additions have doubled in volume. Forensic science are supplemented by examining a crime scene. Profiling component is updated and completed in the history of psychiatry. Portraits of famous killers from 1920 to 1950 are added to the gallery section Serial Killer. A new chapter has been included on the loom investigator : how to embody a policeman, historical fonts and FBI , organized in the U.S. and "bizarre case" crime. Supernatural lovers will appreciate the chapter on various cults and in particular forensic evidence of the passage of creatures of myth !
Finally , the book includes three original scenarios dedicated to the investigation taking place in the United States or France , in the 20s or today.

Forensic Science & Criminal Psychologies is essential to writing real investigative scenarios tool. The many anecdotes and case studies are all sources of inspiration .

153682.name: KEIO Flying Squadron
153682.description:
From the back of the box:

Go Ahead and laugh funny boy. But get it all out now because we're talking "shooter" here. A blistering, "mommy-help-me-I'm scared", Sega CD Shooter. And when you've got the U.S. Navy, the Russian Army, the Seven Gods of Good Fortune and an entire raccoon militia in your face, you'll be glad you're wearing a sexy tutu with fire-engine-red pumps...They'll help to distract Dr. Pon's bloodthirsty minions while you blast his furry buttocks into the stratosphere.

153683.name: Hexagonia
153683.description:
Hexagonia is played on a hex-shaped board comprised of 127 smaller hexagons, seven on each side. The hexes are alternately colored red, white, and blue, except for the central hex, which is colored gold. Each player (one with black pieces, one with white) has eight pawns, four knights, two cannons, and one king. Each piece is capable of capturing enemy pieces, and has a different method of movement. The king piece cannot be captured, but can be put into check as in Chess. A player's king must be moved to the central gold hex to win the game.

According to one account, the game's inventor lived in New Zealand. The exact method for each piece's movement is currently unknown, though there is some mention of the cannon pieces moving somehow laterally.

This game is not to be confused with another Jaques game called Hexagony, which used hexes in a much different and smaller configuration, and with different pieces.

153684.name: Clash Fighter: The Real Time Fighting Card Game
153684.description:
Clash Fighter translates fighting game mechanics into a fast-paced card game where two players compete to build combos in real time! The Standard Edition features six playable character card decks, so two, four, or six players can face off in separate two player matches -- each person controlling a separate character.

The first person to play a Clash card ends real time play, initiating a short turn based phase where damage is calculated. The goal is to deplete your opponent's lifebar while defending your own with strategic combos.

The 12-player Tournament Edition is here: Clash Fighter: The Real Time Fighting Card Game (Tournament Edition)

153685.name: Cabela's Big Game Hunter 2011
153685.description:
User Summary

Cabela's Big Game Hunter 2012 is a direct sequel to Cabela's Dangerous Hunts and builds on the previous game.

153686.name: Clash Fighter: The Real Time Fighting Card Game (Tournament Edition)
153686.description:
Clash Fighter translates fighting game mechanics into a fast-paced card game where two players compete to build combos in real time! The Tournament Edition features six playable characters across 12 card decks, allowing for tournaments of up to 12 players. The Tournament Edition allows players to have a mirror match: two players can use the same character against each other with alternate costumes.

The first person to play a Clash card ends real time play, initiating a short turn based phase where damage is calculated. The goal is to deplete your opponent's lifebar while defending your own with strategic combos.

The 6-player Standard Edition is here: Clash Fighter: The Real Time Fighting Card Game

153687.name: WWII Micro Armour: The Game – Canada in World War II
153687.description: Miniature rules for the Second World War have tended to ignore the Canadian contribution towards the Allied victory in Europe. CANADA IN WORLD WAR II addresses this neglect. It provides both a detailed presentation of the Canadian Army's War Establishment and 13 historical scenarios drawn from some of the Canadians' hardest fought actions in both Italy and Northwest Europe. (From the back cover)

153688.name: Cosmic Carnage
153688.description:
From the back of the box:

What kind of UN-BE-LEEV-ABLY ugly monster is this? Chunks of armor fly off as you pound its body. This beefed-up, maxed-out monstrosity has jetted across the cosmos to beat your brains out! But is it the Alien? Or is it YOU?

153689.name: Kolibri
153689.description:
From the back of the box:

Deep in the Earth, a powerful ancient crystal hums, fueling the balance of nature. But when its toxic twin plummets to Earth, nature totters on the edge of extinction! Only one hope survives - Kolibri. Though small and alone, the hummingbird must battle the invasive mutation in all its malignant forms to restore Earth. But at what cost?

153690.name: Skum
153690.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release of The Manual of Mutants & Monsters provides game stats on the Skum, a subterranean, aquatic race that has been enslaved by the malevolent aboleth.

Includes game information on the skum race, as well as the advanced angler variation. Rounding out this product are two caper ideas for using skum in your game, suggestions on how to combine skum with Cthulhu if the latter is a factor in your game, and 1 new advantage.

153691.name: Motocross Championship
153691.description:
From the back of the box:

Feel the horsepower as you rocket out of the gate and battle through the first turn! Charge down the back stretch, through the whoops and launch over the triples to the checkered flag! Do you have the guts and skills to win on the Motocross Championship circuit? If not, you'll be left in the dust!

153692.name: Tome of Devotion (Redux)
153692.description:
From publisher blurb:

Being a religious fanatic never felt so good!

The Tome of Devotion contains two brand new prestige classes along with additional feats and features designed to give spiritual characters the edge they need to go that exta mile in their fanatical frenzy.

Included is the new prestige class of Zealot, a divine casting class who loves and seeks pain, and wants to share it with as many people as possible! If you ever wanted to be a religious fanatic who gains power from taking or inflicting damage upon yourself, you are in for a treat!

If hunting ghosts, ghouls and demons is more your style, then pull out your shaky handicam and get ready for the new prestige class, the Exorcist. A truly devastating character against anything evil, corrupted or chaotic, the exorcist is a glass cannon of pain and holy blue flames! Tired of having things interrupt your slumber by going bump in the night? If life gives you possessed lemons, you DEMAND they take them back, and purge the land of all that would stand in your path!

Also included are additional feats that can help Clerics fight the good fight, as well as an additional class feature!

Give yourself up to your faith, and smite those who would laugh and call you names!

153693.name: The Maestro Base Class
153693.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roll Over, Beethoven!

The prototype of the modern day rockstar, the maestro is a musical genius whose works entertain the masses and make the dull drudgery that is the life of the peasant a little more livable. While usually a man of the people, some maestros are patronized by established power, such as nobles and certain religions seeking new compositions. Still others look to the adventuring profession for the inspiration they need to produce that next great masterpiece. Regardless of their source of income, maestros are often eccentric and almost always possessed of an incredible ego, making their kind an excellent topic for gossip.

The latest in Interjection Games' growing library of base classes, The Maestro Base Class offers up a fairly simple gameplay concept, which is this: what would happen if a bard could compose and perform his own custom performances? Featuring nearly 70 compositions that can be mixed and matched in a number of musical scores, the maestro plays less like a jack-of-all-trades and more like a mystic theurge that just so happens to have music as one of its two sources of power. Wagner, Beethoven, Mozart, Strauss, and more are represented in various Opuses, canned compositions of enormous power that can cause cannonballs to rain down on the battlefield, make an ally a juggernaut temporarily, and even raise the dead.

For those looking to make music and the creative process the defining concepts for their character, this is the class for you.

The product includes

The Maestro Base Class
A spell list that combines the luck-fixing powers of the oracle and the musical mastery of the bard
The Composition Book, containing 28 intros and outros and 40 melodies
Rules for scribing folios of compositions for use by others
6 Feats
13 Opuses

153694.name: Cavern Chambers
153694.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cavern Chambers is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Cavern Chambers is a geomorphic set, comprising 4 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each component features large cavern chambers, ideal for encounters. Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

153695.name: Cavern Tunnels
153695.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cavern Tunnels is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Cavern Tunnels is a geomorphic set, comprising 4 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each component features narrow winding caverns and debris. Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

153696.name: The Nemesis Bestiary
153696.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Nemesis Bestiary series is an outgrowth of the Space Monsters series of PDFs for the Galaxy Command (D20 Future) setting. Like Space Monsters, the Nemesis Bestiary series takes an interesting piece of stock art and builds a new creature around the art, rather than commissioning art after the text is written. Space Monsters quickly built up a menagerie of fun, original aliens and Nemesis Bestiary Volume One begins the same process.

The Nemesis Bestiary takes a somewhat unusual approach to revealing a monster’s history and behavior. While game-rule information and special powers are clearly delinated, the monster’s history, true nature and motivations aren’t. Instead, reports from the field, written by adventurers who’ve survived an encounter with the beast give first-hand, though often fragmentary and sometimes contradictory, information. The rationale is that even if your players have read the statblocks for the new creatures in this PDF, they still don’t know everything about the monster. The game master is free to improvise, expand and extrapolate as desired to build a unique encounter around one of these powerful and intriguing new beasts.

153697.name: True Elves
153697.description:
From publisher blurb:

True Elves presents a brand new, yet completely familiar, vision of Elves for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. True Elves are keen eyed and pragmatic, with well-ordered kingdoms that produce wonders of art and architecture. True Elves have a cultural tradition of archery, and are seemingly bred for excellence with the bow.

True Elves are the indomitable and beautiful snipers of classic literature and recent cinema fantasy, rather than the unsleeping, trapdoor finding breed of Elves so familiar to generations of gamers.

153698.name: Mantids
153698.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mantids are a bold race of humanoids evolved from insects and living in perfect symbiosis with powerful insect companions. They live in teeming, filthy cities crowded with chitin-skinned bipeds and their gigantic insect counterparts. Mantids have the intelligence and adaptability of humanity, married to the sheer physical might of the giant insects. Much of the race’s military might comes from the trained vermin that every adult Mantid bio-bonds with- impressive beasts that boast flight, venom, exotic senses and nearly invulnerable armor…. All powers of the insect kingdom shared by their Mantid masters.

153699.description:
Your sail boat proudly cuts through the waters of the caribbean, carrying you closer to the many treasures marked on your old map. Suddenly you hear the dreadful sound of crashing wood. The razor-sharp reefs tore a menacing hole into the hull of your boat. But as a true salty sailor, there's no giving up! Can you find all the treasure while keeping your leaky boat afloat?

Leaky Boat is a real-time solitaire game (free to print n' play), where you are constantly up to your neck in watery peril. You frantically roll your dice to navigate through dangerous waters and to collect the riches buried on faraway islands. A unique sandtimer-mechanism simulates the treasure chests weighing you down and the salty waters continuously pouring into your boat as you struggle to stay afloat.

“Just a few big treasures and then I’ll stop” you say to yourself as you sail towards the horizon, your boat circled by hungry sharks…
153699.name: Leaky Boat

153702.name: Napoleonic Warfare 1813c
153702.description:
Miniature rules for Napoleonic Warfare 1813c by Charles Reavley.

From the rules booklet:

The object of the rules is to reproduce in a War Game the weapon capabilities and the tactics existing at the time of the Napoleonic Wars.

Ground scale is 1mm = 1 yard
Time scale is 2 1/2 minutes per period.
Game is designed for 20mm scale figures.

boardgamecompilation: Darkest Night: With an Inner Light
153703.description:
Darkest Night, by designer Jeremy Lennert, is a fully-cooperative board game for one to four players (up to six with variants), set in a kingdom broken under a necromancer’s shadow. Each player takes on the role of one of the kingdom’s last heroes (nine playable characters), each with a unique set of special abilities, just as they hatch a plan to save the realm.

The Necromancer Bundle contains the Darkest Night base game plus all of its current expansions and one promo.

Expansions Included:

Darkest Night: Nymph Promo
Darkest Night: On Shifting Winds
Darkest Night: With an Inner Light

Note: This item is only available for sale from the Victory Point Games website.
153703.name: Darkest Night: Necromancer Bundle
boardgameaccessory: Darkest Night: Necromancer Stand-up and Dice Tower

153704.name: Sturdy Birdy
153704.description:
Sturdy Birdy - Roll the dice! Strike a pose! Find the perfect balance!

Reggie the Pigeon dreams of life in the circus as a high wire acrobat. (Sadly, Reggie's flight abilities have never taken off.)

Reggie needs your help to perfect 12 poses to land the high wire balancing, birdseed providing job he's always dreamed of.

To do that players must master 12 unique poses and be the first to make it to the end of the line. Ahh... 12 poses can't be so tough you say. Wait until you add counting spectators, flapping wings and a few choruses of "tweety, tweet, tweet"!

Strength, balance, counting, and determination all come into play as players attempt to master 12 different poses. On a player's turn they roll the dice to determine how long they must hold a pose and where on their body they must balance a bean bag while holding that pose. The first player to make their way through all of the poses wins.

No reading required.

Contains: 12 large Reggie the Pigeon Pose Cards, 12 card stands, 4 seed bags, 2 foam dice

153705.name: Game Geek (Issue 13 - Jan 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Leviathans: The Bridge to Far Scenario
153705.description:
Game Geek Issue 13

Barbarian Prince
New Battle Tiles
Wizards of Avalon
